question.title: Why app crashes on shared preferences?

node.contents: It might be helpful you indicate which line is 54 (as in at hgt_app.wallace_media.MainActivity.onCreate(MainActivity.java:54)

astNode.text: It might be helpful you indicate which line is 54 (as in at hgt_app.wallace_media.MainActivity.onCreate(MainActivity.java:54)

node.contents: Now with the logcat it's easier to see the actual problem. `static` like this is a design smell but it doesn't always cause an exception.

astNode.text: Now with the logcat it's easier to see the actual problem. `static` like this is a design smell but it doesn't always cause an exception.

node.contents: Remove the `static` for the non-constant variables in `MainActivity` and redesign your app so that you don't need to rely on those static variables.

astNode.text: Remove the `static` for the non-constant variables in `MainActivity` and redesign your app so that you don't need to rely on those static variables.

node.contents: @laalto im not a hardcore programmer but I cant imagine any way passing bluetooth device names,macs etc, except static variables. When dialog pop ups, I need to be able to reuse bluetooth device that u have chosen everywhere in my app.

astNode.text: @laalto im not a hardcore programmer but I cant imagine any way passing bluetooth device names,macs etc, except static variables. When dialog pop ups, I need to be able to reuse bluetooth device that u have chosen everywhere in my app.

node.contents: My app doesnt save string into shared preference at all. First few times when you close and open app it does nothing, 3rd, 4th time it crashes everytime. I have 2 classes. MainActivity.java:

astNode.text: My app doesnt save string into shared preference at all. First few times when you close and open app it does nothing, 3rd, 4th time it crashes everytime. I have 2 classes. MainActivity.java:

elements.contents: public class MainActivity extends ActionBarActivity implements listenForDeviceChoose{ public static TextView deviceName; public static final String deviceNameKey = "deviceNameKey"; public static SharedPreferences sharedpreferences; public static final String MeinePrefs = "Preferences"; protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) { super.onCreate(savedInstanceState); requestWindowFeature(Window.FEATURE_NO_TITLE); setContentView(R.layout.activity_main); sharedpreferences = getSharedPreferences(MeinePrefs, Context.MODE_PRIVATE); if (sharedpreferences.contains(deviceNameKey)) { deviceName.setText(sharedpreferences.getString(deviceNameKey, "")); } if (savedInstanceState == null) { getSupportFragmentManager().beginTransaction() .add(R.id.container, new PlaceholderFragment()).commit(); } } public static TextView getDeviceNameHolder(Activity activity) { deviceName = (TextView)activity.findViewById(R.id.deviceName); return deviceName; } }

units.rawText: public class MainActivity extends ActionBarActivity implements listenForDeviceChoose{ public static TextView deviceName; public static final String deviceNameKey = "deviceNameKey"; public static SharedPreferences sharedpreferences; public static final String MeinePrefs = "Preferences"; protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) { super.onCreate(savedInstanceState); requestWindowFeature(Window.FEATURE_NO_TITLE); setContentView(R.layout.activity_main); sharedpreferences = getSharedPreferences(MeinePrefs, Context.MODE_PRIVATE); if (sharedpreferences.contains(deviceNameKey)) { deviceName.setText(sharedpreferences.getString(deviceNameKey, "")); } if (savedInstanceState == null) { getSupportFragmentManager().beginTransaction() .add(R.id.container, new PlaceholderFragment()).commit(); } } public static TextView getDeviceNameHolder(Activity activity) { deviceName = (TextView)activity.findViewById(R.id.deviceName); return deviceName; } }

elements.contents: builder.setPositiveButton("OK", new DialogInterface.OnClickListener() { @Override public void onClick(DialogInterface dialog, int id) { choice = ((AlertDialog)dialog).getListView().getCheckedItemPosition(); MainActivity.getDeviceNameHolder(getActivity()).setText(devices[choice]); //String deviceNamebuffer = devices[choice].toString(); Editor editor = MainActivity.sharedpreferences.edit(); editor.putString(MainActivity.deviceNameKey, devices[choice].toString()); editor.commit(); }

node.contents: The fragment transaction that inflates the fragment and attaches it to the activity view hierarchy runs in activity `onStart()`. Before that `findViewById()` on the activity view hierarchy doesn't find any fragment views.

astNode.text: The fragment transaction that inflates the fragment and attaches it to the activity view hierarchy runs in activity `onStart()`. Before that `findViewById()` on the activity view hierarchy doesn't find any fragment views.

node.contents: I just put everything from my fragment layout to main activity layout and it works perfectly. Thank you a lot. But now here comes another question. Everything was in fragment layout and app was working. why was it working all the time? because of Placeholderfragment which is included by default when you create a new android project? I commented it out. Everything what has something to do with fragment layout is now commented out. Is that correct or should I leave it uncommented? and why?

astNode.text: I just put everything from my fragment layout to main activity layout and it works perfectly. Thank you a lot. But now here comes another question. Everything was in fragment layout and app was working. why was it working all the time? because of Placeholderfragment which is included by default when you create a new android project? I commented it out. Everything what has something to do with fragment layout is now commented out. Is that correct or should I leave it uncommented? and why?

node.contents: You are absolutely right, I didnt notice it but it doesnt help. I get same bunc of error in logcat. Now after first time when I re-open the app.

astNode.text: You are absolutely right, I didnt notice it but it doesnt help. I get same bunc of error in logcat. Now after first time when I re-open the app.

node.contents: Is the view in the activity or in the fragment layout?

astNode.text: Is the view in the activity or in the fragment layout?

node.contents: You have not initialized deviceName and it crashes when the code path calling setText() on it in onCreate() is taken.

astNode.text: You have not initialized deviceName and it crashes when the code path calling setText() on it in onCreate() is taken.

node.contents: to onCreate() after setContentView(), assuming the view is in your activity_main layout (and not e.g. fragment).

astNode.text: to onCreate() after setContentView(), assuming the view is in your activity_main layout (and not e.g. fragment).
